reviewGeneral.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ciel Marronier is a PVE-oriented utility tank that leans heavily into DEF shred debuffs. Ciel applies a permanent 20% DEF shred debuff and her ultimate applies a short-lasting 80% DEF shred debuff on top of that, allowing her to single-handedly apply -100% DEF shred. For her extremely potent high DEF shred debuff and above average survivability (for cost), Ciel is considered one of the best frontline tanks in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ciel is highly valued for her ability to individually apply -100% DEF shred, something that previously needed multiple debuffers to achieve. DEF shred will provide a greater damage increase than an equivalent amount of ATK% (up to 100%, as you can’t shred more than 100% of a target’s DEF). PVE comps typically aim to mitigate 100% of the enemy’s DEF. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In PVE, Ciel is used in burst damage setups. Her burst of -100% DEF shred removes the need for other DEF shredders and pushes the damage ceiling by creating space in the team to fit more offensive (de)buffers. Ciel is universally appreciated in Raids and sees regular use in Danger Close. Of note, Ciel can struggle in Danger Close Expert mode due to the increased overall stats on bosses.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In PVP, Ciel periodically sees play as a striker frontline option. Depending on the weekly bans, certain weeks necessitate strong anti-defender damage dealers to punch through the frontline. Ciel can be used to punish comps that lean too heavily into killing defenders. As a striker, Ciel can become obscenely difficult for rangers to kill, especially with her damage tolerance fully stacked. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ciel’s damage reflect gimmick, though novel, has little practical application in the game. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

description.description: A Striker who can reduce enemy DEF

baseDescription.baseDescription: Swings her weapon, dealing AoE damage 3 times.

Swings her weapon upon deployment. Each hit taken during deployment grants self +1% DMG RDC (cannot be canceled). After every 3 basic attacks, delivers an enhanced attack to the enemy in front with slight knockback, applying a 5% DEF reduction debuff (Max 4 stacks)

level5.level5: Grants herself 100% True DMG reflection during deployment (Only direct attacks that are dealt to HP is reflected, received damage cannot exceed self-max HP). Immune to all hitstuns during deployment.

baseDescription.baseDescription: Leaps forward to deals AoE damage then returns. The attack unconditionally CRITs on enemies below 50% HP.

level5.level5: Grants self a barrier equal to 30% of max HP after leaping forward.

baseDescription.baseDescription: Ciel does not know spearmanship but instead, she is accustomed to punching and kicking. Delivers a powerful impact on the ground that sends shrapnel flying, dealing AoE damage. Enemies hit by the last shrapnel have their DEF reduced by 50% for 4s.
